documents.document: Today we welcomed seven doctors and nurses from @GovNL to Ontario. They join the incredible team who arrived last week. Thank you for continuing to support our province as we respond to the third wave of #COVID19. We are grateful for your selflessness, courage and compassion. https://t.co/te3xXMDMSG

A stay-at-home order is currently in effect for all of Ontario. Only leave home for essential purposes such as food, health care, exercise or work. Its the law. Stay home, stay safe, save lives. Learn more about this and other #PublicHealth measures: https://t.co/9ta1KL6wCA https://t.co/ZLTXgJGIiY
As of 8:00 p.m. yesterday, 5,467,120 doses of the COVID-19 vaccine have been administered. Todays numbers will be available at 10:30 a.m. at https://t.co/ypmgZbVRvn.
Ontario is reporting 2,791 cases of #COVID19 and over 33,700 tests completed. Locally, there are 931 new cases in Toronto, 653 in Peel, 275 in York Region, 147 in Durham and 128 in Hamilton.

Ontario is reporting 3,436 cases of #COVID19 and nearly 33,200 tests completed. Locally, there are 985 new cases in Toronto, 714 in Peel, 351 in York Region, 271 in Durham and 194 in Hamilton.

Starting today, individuals 18+ in hot spot communities are now eligible to book a #COVID19 vaccine appointment at a mass immunization clinic through the provincial online booking system or through public health units that use their own booking system. https://t.co/vOAx29BA8s https://t.co/RfobQpoKtd

Happy #Easter to Orthodox Christians across the province. May your day be filled with love and hope, as you welcome spring and celebrate life. Please remember to celebrate safely at home with your household. https://t.co/N451H3bJbv

Starting May 6 at 8:00 a.m., individuals ages 50+ in 2021 will be eligible to book a #COVID19 vaccine appointment through the provincial online booking system and call centre or through public health units that use their own booking system. https://t.co/vOAx29BA8s https://t.co/t07BDBBt45

Starting May 3 at 8:00 a.m., individuals 18+ in 2021 who live in hot spot communities will be eligible to book a #COVID19 vaccine appointment through the provincial online booking system or through public health units that use their own booking system. https://t.co/vOAx29BA8s https://t.co/3JRS5GCACT

During the weeks of May 3 and May 10, Ontario will allocate 50% of upcoming vaccines shipments to hot spot communities - an increase of over one million doses as a targeted, time-limited measure. Allocations in other public health units remain the same. https://t.co/yG6Wh0Jcwk https://t.co/DM1NetbJEW

Today on #FirstRespondersDay, we honour our courageous first responder professionals and volunteers who answer the call to protect Ontarians and save lives. Thank you for your incredible service and unwavering commitment to being there in our time of need. https://t.co/ce7HopPkmM

Today is #DoctorsDay and #NationalPhysiciansDay. Throughout the pandemic, Ontario's 30,000+ doctors have worked tirelessly to be there when we need them the most, making a difference in countless lives every day. Thank you for your incredible service. You truly are our heroes. https://t.co/JktBZsx70M

Rigorously tested and approved by Health Canada, the #COVID19 vaccine is the best way to protect you and those around you. Everyone is strongly encouraged to sign up to get vaccinated as soon as you are eligible. Learn more: https://t.co/aj03EIiNcr https://t.co/sDH6LYHvF8

Ontario has now administered at least one dose of the #COVID19 vaccine to 40% of Ontarians aged 18+. With a steady supply of vaccines expected, the province is preparing to ramp up its vaccine rollout and expand booking eligibility across the province. https://t.co/7XnXQs5HZw https://t.co/Zhmmu7uouv

Our government is working with public health units and businesses to set up workplace vaccination clinics in hot spot communities. These clinics will vaccinate essential workers aged 18+ and members of the surrounding community. Learn more: https://t.co/IxfJE5iYgT https://t.co/HFsjmhdTMk
RT @RobinMartinPC: Im honoured to greet the health heroes from @GovNL who just arrived in Ontario to help support our health care system.

Thank you to the courageous volunteers, @PremierofNL and @GovNL for supporting Ontarios response to the third wave of #COVID19 driven by variants. The selflessness of these nurses and doctors is nothing short of remarkable and heroic. We are truly grateful. https://t.co/4NLaLesEr0

Pregnant individuals who are in a public health unit not using the provincial booking system should contact their local public health unit to book an appointment.
Pregnant individuals living in a public health unit using the provincial booking system can call the provincial call centre at 1-888-999-6488 to book their appointment.

As of April 23, all pregnant individuals can register for #COVID19 vaccination appointments under the highest risk health conditions in Phase Two of the provinces vaccine rollout. https://t.co/hS6jL4E84y

Ontario continues to expand the number of sites that can administer vaccines. Over 1,400 pharmacies are offering the AstraZeneca #COVID19 vaccine to those aged 40+. You can find a pharmacy in your community and book your appointment directly at https://t.co/emPnyQfI5t https://t.co/3gwm7O456n
